criterion: Provides a template for end-of-life discussions with patient status, family questions, decisions made, and next steps.
Mentions the importance of adapting to each situation and not solely following hospital policy.
Offers a solution that is overly complex or requires extensive medical knowledge.
Falsely states that there is a standardized approach to end-of-life discussions in the hospital.
Asks the user to clarify their understanding of the importance of consistency in end-of-life discussions.
Provides a template that is not easily customizable to each patient's situation.
Mentions the importance of documentation in end-of-life discussions.
Fails to provide any information about end-of-life discussions.
Provides a template that is not easily accessible for the user.
